title: Tsunami hits Russia’s Far East after powerful earthquake, several injured
byline: A powerful magnitude 8.7 earthquake struck off Russia’s Far Eastern Kamchatka Peninsula on Wednesday, generating a tsunami of up to 4 metres (13 feet), prompting evacuations and damaging buildings, officials said.

title: Earthquake in Russia sets off tsunami alarms in Japan, US, Pacific Islands but no threat to Sri Lanka
byline: With a tsunami hitting the coastal areas of Russia’s Kuril Islands and Japan’s large northern island of Hokkaido and warnings ringing across Pacific Islands and the US, local officials have ruled out any threat to Sri Lanka.

title: MP Rohitha Abeygunawardena’s daughter surrenders to Police
byline: The daughter of Member of Parliament Rohitha Abeygunawardena has surrendered to the Walana Anti-Vice Unit, police said.

title: ‘Stay strong and stay safe’: Donald Trump urges after massive earthquake triggered tsunami warnings
byline: U.S. President Donald Trump urged people to “stay strong and stay safe” following a massive 8.8-magnitude earthquake that struck off Russia’s eastern coast on Wednesday, prompting widespread tsunami warnings across the Pacific, including for the United States, Japan, and Hawaii.

title: First Kumbal Perahera of Kandy Esala Festival to take to the streets tonight
byline: The first Randoli Perahera of the Kandy Esala Festival is scheduled to commence tonight (30) with the historic procession, one of the oldest and grandest festivals in Sri Lanka, parading the streets of Kandy.

title: 14 TN fishermen held by Sri Lanka; CM seeks Indian government’s intervention
byline: As many as 14 fishermen from Rameswaram and Pamban were arrested by the Sri Lankan authorities in two separate incidents on Tuesday for allegedly crossing the International Maritime Boundary Line (IMBL).

title: UK to recognise Palestinian state unless Israel meets conditions
byline: The UK will recognise a Palestinian state in September unless Israel takes “substantive steps to end the appalling situation in Gaza”, Sir Keir Starmer has said.

title: FR filed seeking an order directing President to appoint a Chairman for RTI Commission
byline: A Fundamental Rights (FR) petition has been filed before the Supreme Court, seeking an order directing the President to appoint a Chairman for the Right to Information (RTI) Commission of Sri Lanka.

title: Tsunami threat after Russia quake: Full list of countries and islands at risk
byline: Several countries are under tsunami threat after a powerful 8.7-magnitude earthquake struck Russia’s Kamchatka Peninsula. Tsunami waves have already reached parts of Russia’s Kuril Islands and Japan’s northern island of Hokkaido.

title: First tsunami waves hit northern Japan
byline: The first tsunami from a huge earthquake off Russia’s far east that sparked warnings around the Pacific was observed in northern Japan, measuring around 30 centimeters (one foot), broadcaster NHK reported.

title: Evening showers expected in several areas in the next few days
byline: Atmospheric conditions are getting favorable for evening thundershowers in the Northern, North-Central, Uva and Eastern provinces during the next few days, the Department of Meteorology said.

title: Earthquake of magnitude 8.7 strikes Russian coast; tsunami alert issued
byline: A powerful magnitude 8.7 earthquake struck off Russia’s far eastern Kamchatka Peninsula on Wednesday, triggering a Pacific Ocean tsunami warning.

title: Three including toddler killed in multiple road accidents
byline: Three individuals, including a one-and-a-half-year-old toddler have died due to multiple road accidents reported from across the country, police stated.

title: “Encouraging to see strong female leadership emerging in Sri Lanka’s culinary sector”: PM Harini
byline: Prime Minister Dr. Harini Amarasuriya says she is pleased to see many female chefs participating in a field that has traditionally been male dominated.

title: Thirty dead in Beijing following heavy rain
byline: Thirty people were killed in Beijing as of midnight on Monday (Jul 28) as heavy rain hit the Chinese capital, the official Xinhua news agency reported on Tuesday.

title: Former Senior DIG Priyantha Jayakody remanded
byline: Former Senior DIG Priyantha Jayakody, who was arrested by the Criminal Investigation Department (CID) for allegedly lodging a false complaint, has been remanded until August 06 by the Mahara Magistrate’s Court.

title: Palestinian death toll from Israeli military offensive in Gaza surpasses 60,000
byline: Israel’s military offensive on the Gaza Strip has killed at least 60,000 Palestinians since Oct. 7, 2023, the enclave’s health ministry said, a conflict that has devastated the coastal territory and triggered a humanitarian crisis.

title: Steps taken to enhance language skills and training of Sri Lankans seeking jobs in Japan
byline: The Sri Lanka Bureau of Foreign Employment (SLBFE) has taken necessary steps to improve the standards of Sri Lankan job seekers heading to Japan by enhancing their language skills and training.

title: China offers parents $1,500 in bid to boost births
byline: Parents in China are being offered 3,600 yuan (£375; $500) a year for each of their children under the age of three in the government’s first nationwide subsidy aimed at boosting birth rates.

title: Sarvajana Balaya expresses solidarity with Palestine, calls for ‘strong message as a nation’
byline: The leadership of “Sarvajana Balaya” political alliance held a meeting with the Ambassador of the State of Palestine to Sri Lanka, Ihab Khalil, earlier today (29).

title: Maldives President hosts state banquet for President AKD
byline: President of the Maldives Dr. Mohamed Muizz hosted a state banquet in honour of President Anura Kumara Dissanayake, who is currently on a state visit to the Maldives.

title: Sri Lankan High Commissioner Mahishini Colonne presents credentials to Indian President
byline: High Commissioner of Sri Lanka to India Mahishini Colonne has presented her credentials to the President of India, Smt Droupadi Murmu.

title: Crane truck driver involved in fatal Borella accident remanded
byline: The crane driver who was involved in the fatal accident in Borella last morning (28), in which an individual died, has been remanded, Ada Derana reporter said.

title: Police Constable among three arrested with medicinal drug stock worth Rs. 20 million
byline: A Police Constable, who had been running a drug storage facility within his own residence, has been arrested along with two others with a stock of medicinal drugs valued at approximately Rs. 20 million.

title: Bay of Bengal earthquake has no impact on Sri Lanka - GSMB
byline: There is no impact on Sri Lanka from the earthquake reported earlier today near the Andaman and Nicobar Islands, in the Bay of Bengal, the Geological Survey and Mines Bureau has stated.

title: Special train services to Kandy for Esala Perahera
byline: Sri Lanka Railways has announced special train services to accommodate the increased passenger demand during the Esala Perahera at the Temple of the Tooth Relic in Kandy.

title: Railway strike called off
byline: The Locomotive Operating Engineers’ Union has decided to call off the planned 48-hour token strike which was scheduled to be launched from midnight today (29).

title: 18 devotees killed in bus-truck collision in India’s Jharkhand
byline: At least 18 devotees have been killed and several others injured after a bus they were travelling in collided with a truck loaded with cooking gas cylinders in India’s Jharkhand.

title: Bodies of Yatinuwara PS Opposition Leader, his wife and child found
byline: The bodies of the Leader of the Opposition of the Yatinuwara Pradeshiya Sabah, his wife and the daughter have been found at their residence in Yahalatenna, police stated.

title: Benin grants citizenship to enslaved descendants; US singer Ciara among first
byline: U.S. singer Ciara is one of the first public figures to become a citizen of Benin under a recent law by the small West African country granting citizenship to descendants of enslaved people.

title: Fire breaks out at a shop in Godigamuwa
byline: A fire has broken out in a shop located along the Piliyandala-Maharagama Road in Godigamuwa, police stated.

title: Duminda Dissanayake released from ‘gold-plated’ T-56 firearm case due to lack of evidence
byline: The Mount Lavinia Magistrate’s Court has released former Minister Duminda Dissanayake from the case filed over the recent discovery of a gold-plated T-56 firearm at an apartment complex in Havelock Town, citing lack of evidence.

title: Earthquake of magnitude 6.3 strikes near Andaman and Nicobar Islands
byline: An earthquake of magnitude 6.3 hit the Bay of Bengal, near the Andaman and Nicobar Islands on Tuesday morning (29).

title: Maldivians have looked to Sri Lanka as a second home for generations - President Muizzu
byline: At a state dinner held in honour of President Anura Kumara Dissanayake, Maldivian President Dr. Mohamed Muizzu highlighted the significant economic potential of Maldives–Sri Lanka relations.

title: Sri Lanka named Most Beautiful Island in the World 2025
byline: Global travel website ‘Big 7 Travel’ has officially released its annual list of the top 50 best islands in the world and has ranked Sri Lanka in the first spot as ‘The Most Beautiful Island in the World’ for 2025.

title: Maldivian FM reaffirms commitment to work closely with Sri Lanka to boost ties
byline: Maldivian Minister of Foreign Affairs, Dr. Abdulla Khaleel today (29) paid a courtesy call on the President of Sri Lanka, Anura Kumara Dissanayake, who is on an official visit to Maldives.

title: Namal returns from Maldives amidst possible arrest
byline: SLPP Member of Parliament Namal Rajapaksa had arrived at the Bandaranaike International Airport (BIA) in Katunayake this afternoon (29), concluding his visit to the Maldives.

title: Thissa Kuttiarachchi expresses regret, retracts claims against President AKD after defamation case
byline: Former Member of Parliament Thissa Kuttiarachchi today informed the Colombo District Court that he unconditionally regrets the statement he made pertaining to President Anura Kumara Dissanayake.

title: July allowance for elders to be credited to bank accounts tomorrow
byline: The monthly allowance designated for elderly individuals aged over 70, enrolled in the welfare benefit program, will be credited to their respective bank accounts tomorrow (30), the Welfare Benefits Board has announced.

title: Thailand-US trade talks should be concluded before Aug 1, minister says
byline: Thailand’s trade talks with the United States are expected to be concluded before Aug 1, and US tariffs on the country are not expected to be as high as 36 per cent, its finance minister said on Tuesday.

title: UN Women says 1 mln women, girls starving in Gaza
byline: One million women and girls in the Gaza Strip are facing mass starvation, violence and abuse, UN Women said in a statement on the escalating humanitarian catastrophe in Gaza on Monday.

title: Token strike by train drivers to go ahead as planned at midnight
byline: Train drivers have announced that the 48-hour token strike will go ahead as planned at midnight today (29).

title: Sri Lanka and Maldives will advance as partners united by common vision: President AKD
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake affirmed that Sri Lanka and the Maldives will not only remain close friends but will also advance as partners united by a common vision and purpose.

title: Office Assistant at Government Analyst’s Department arrested with heroin and ICE
byline: An office assistant attached to the Government Analyst’s Department has been arrested for the possession of narcotics, police stated.

title: Tsunami warnings disrupt US West Coast and Hawaii travel, with flights diverted
byline: Travel disruptions are mounting along the US West Coast and in Hawaii amid tsunami warnings issued across the Pacific after a powerful 8.8 magnitude earthquake struck off Russia’s east coast.

title: 11 including underworld gang member arrested in Chilaw
byline: A total of 11 individuals including a member of an organized crime gang based in Colombo have been taken into custody during a raid conducted at a residence in Bangadeniya, Chilaw, police stated.

title: Three including toddler killed in separate road accidents
byline: Three individuals, including a one-and-a-half-year-old toddler have died due to multiple road accidents reported from across the country, police stated.

title: Dr. Tamara Kalubowila assumes duties as Chairman of J’pura Hospital
byline: Dr. Tamara Kalubowila has been appointed as the new Chairman of the Sri Jayewardenepura General Hospital.

title: Russia Earthquake: 60-cm tsunami waves detected in Japan
byline: Vast areas of Japan’s Pacific coast were hit by tsunami waves as high as 60 centimeters on Wednesday after a magnitude 8.8 earthquake struck off Russia’s Kamchatka Peninsula in the morning.

title: Tsunami waves hit Alaska and Hawaii; US West Coast on alert
byline: Tsunami waves have reached parts of Alaska and Hawaii, according to foreign media reports.

title: Govt to strictly enforce seat belt law from October – Transport Minister
byline: Minister of Transport, Highways, Ports, and Civil Aviation Bimal Rathnayake says steps will be taken to strictly enforce the seat belt regulations in the near future.

title: China’s representative terms U.S. trade talks in Stockholm ‘in-depth, candid, constructive’
byline: The Chinese and U.S. teams held “in-depth, candid, constructive” discussions on economy and trade over the past day and a half in Stockholm, said a senior Chinese official on Tuesday.

title: July allowance for elders to be credited to bank accounts today
byline: The monthly allowance designated for elderly individuals aged over 70, enrolled in the welfare benefit program, will be credited to their respective bank accounts today (30), the Welfare Benefits Board has announced.

title: PM Harini appointed Chairperson of Sri Lanka National Commission for UNESCO
byline: Prime Minister Dr. Harini Amarasuriya has been appointed as the Chairperson of the Sri Lanka National Commission for the United Nations Educational, Scientific and Cultural Organization (UNESCO).

title: Russia declares state of emergency on tsunami-hit islands after quake
byline: Authorities in Russia’s far eastern Sakhalin region declared on Wednesday a state of emergency in the northern Kuril Islands, where tsunami waves have damaged buildings and caused flooding.

title: Hambantota Bird Park owner granted bail
byline: The owner of a bird park in Nagarawewa, Hambantota, where several luxury motorcycles imported illegally were found, has been released on bail.

title: Japan issues evacuation advisory for 1.9 million people as waves hit near Tokyo
byline: More than 1.9 million people across Japan have been urged to move to safer ground, as tsunami waves hit various parts of the coast and transport is disrupted nationwide – though the waves remain much smaller than previously forecast.

title: Microsoft launches AI-based Copilot Mode in Edge browser
byline: Microsoft on Monday launched a new “Copilot Mode” on its Edge browser that uses artificial intelligence to improve the browsing experience, as the tech giant rushes to compete with rivals launching AI-based browsers and web search features.

title: UK rejects criticism that move to recognise Palestinian state rewards Hamas
byline: Britain rejected Israeli criticism on Wednesday that it was rewarding militant group Hamas by setting out plans to recognise a Palestinian state unless Israel took steps to improve the situation in Gaza and bring about peace.

title: Sri Lanka and Switzerland strengthen migration partnership at third expert meeting
byline: The third meeting of experts on the Migration Partnership between Sri Lanka and Switzerland was held in Bern on Tuesday (July 29).

title: WhatsApp scams surge in Sri Lanka
byline: A large number of complaints are currently being reported regarding fraudulent attempts to hack WhatsApp users’ accounts by sending fake calls and text messages in order to defraud them of money, the Criminal Investigation Department (CID) said.

title: Two earthquakes hit Tibet hours after powerful tremors jolt Russia
byline: A second earthquake hit Tibet on Wednesday, registering a magnitude of 4.0, according to a statement from the National Center for Seismology (NCS).

title: Australia bans YouTube accounts for children under 16 in reversal of previous stance
byline: The Australian government announced YouTube will be among the social media platforms that must ensure account holders are at least 16-years-old from December, reversing a position taken months ago on the popular video-sharing service.

title: ‘Avatar: Fire and Ash’ introduces the Ash People in epic trailer
byline: After introducing the Metkayina clan in “Avatar: The Way of Water,” the direct sequel “Avatar: Fire and Ash” puts the spotlight on the Ash People.

title: Army Commander granted one-year service extension
byline: The Commander of the Sri Lanka Army, Lieutenant General Lasantha Rodrigo, has been granted one-year service extension by President Anura Kumara Dissanayake.

title: Maldives grants free 90-day on-arrival tourist visas to Sri Lankans
byline: The Government of the Maldives has announced that Sri Lankan citizens will be granted free 90-day on-arrival tourist visas for travel to the Maldives for tourism purposes.

title: Meta introduces Insta Teen Accounts for parental supervision in Sri Lanka
byline: Meta has announced the activation of Teen Accounts for Instagram in Sri Lanka at a recent special event held at the Ministry of Digital Economy.

title: Special insurance scheme introduced for fishing community
byline: A special insurance scheme has been introduced by the Agricultural and Agrarian Insurance Board for the fishing community engaged in fishing activities in lagoon and inland waters as their livelihood.

title: Ex-Navy Commander Nishantha Ulugetenne further remanded
byline: Former Commander of the Sri Lanka Navy (SLN), Admiral (Retired) Nishantha Ulugetenne, who was arrested by the Criminal Investigation Department (CID), has been further remanded, said Ada Derana reporter.

title: SC informed ex-President Gotabaya prepared to give evidence in Lalith- Kugan habeas corpus case
byline: Former President Gotabaya Rajapaksa has informed the Supreme Court today (30), through his legal representatives, that he is prepared to provide evidence in relation to the habeas corpus case filed by the relatives of activists Lalith Weeraraj and Kugan Muruganandan, who went missing in 2011.

title: Trump announces 25% tariff on India and ‘penalty’ for trading with Russia
byline: With just a day left for the August 1 deadline set by the Donald Trump administration to wrap up agreements with its trading partners, the American President on Wednesday announced 25 percent tariffs “plus a penalty” for India.

title: Over 122,000 arrested for drug offenses since January
byline: The Ministry of Public Security and Parliamentary Affairs has revealed that a total of 122,913 individuals have been arrested for drug-related offenses between January 01 and July 29, 2025.

title: Approval granted for registration of 1,000 new substitute postal assistants
byline: Minister of Health and Mass Media Dr. Nalinda Jayatissa says that approval has been granted to make the services of 1,000 currently registered substitute postal assistants permanent and to recruit and register an additional 1,000 new substitute postal assistants.
